issue.title: Fix ``similarity`` checker fails with ``ignore-signatures`` option enabled on function with docstring-only body

labels.name: Crash ðŸ’¥
labels.description: A bug that makes pylint crash

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
## Description

Fix a crash caused by the newly introduced ignore-signatures option for similarities checker fails for functions with an empty body with docstring only. Also include some refactor necessary so pre-commit works (trailing whitespace added in report).

## Type of Changes


|     | Type                   |
| --- | ---------------------- |
| âœ“   | :bug: Bug fix          |
| âœ“   | :hammer: Refactoring   |

## Related Issue

Closes #4648

body: Thank you for opening the issue, and for all the detail provided, it will be fixed in 2.9.3.
Yes, I just wanted to avoid the crash in 2.9.3. Would you be interested in doing the real fix ðŸ˜„ ?

@Pierre-Sassoulas yes ðŸ™ƒ 

Additionally, we could try to improve `ignore-signatures` option to also ignore class methods signatures as well, because currently, it doesn't. Only functions signatures are ignored.

But possibly it could be another improvement issue.
Could I create both of them?
Sound great ! Fixing the false negative can go in 2.9, but we'll wait for ``2.10`` to merge the "ignore class methods signatures" :)

issue.title: Similarities checker with "ignore-signatures" option enabled ignores functions with docstring-only bodies

labels.name: False Positive ðŸ¦Ÿ
labels.description: A message is emitted but nothing is wrong with the code

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
#4648 follow-up.

### Steps to reproduce

Given multiple files:
```
module\
    __init__.py
    a.py
    b.py
```

`a.py`:
```python
def example_func(
    arg1,
    arg2,
    arg3,
    arg4,
):
    """Valid function definition with docstring only."""
```

`b.py`:
```python
def example_func(
    arg1,
    arg2,
    arg3,
    arg4,
):
    """Valid function definition with docstring only."""
```

### Current behavior

Result of `pylint --disable=all --enable=similarities --ignore-signatures=yes module`:
```
************* Module module.b
module/b.py:1:0: R0801: Similar lines in 2 files
==module.a:0
==module.b:0
def example_func(
    arg1,
    arg2,
    arg3,
    arg4,
):
    """Valid function definition with docstring only.""" (duplicate-code)

-----------------------------------
Your code has been rated at 5.00/10
```

### Expected behavior

`duplicate-code` error shouldn't be reported in this case.

**Note**: if functions have bodies everything works correctly. You could add `pass` to the example functions above and no `duplicate-code` error would be reported.

### pylint --version output

Result of `pylint --version` output:

```
pylint 2.9.3
astroid 2.6.2
Python 3.8.2 (default, Jun  8 2021, 11:59:35) 
[Clang 12.0.5 (clang-1205.0.22.11)]
```

body: Created both issues I have mentioned: #4652, #4653.
